meanings.definition: To absorb or engross the mind or attention of someone.
meanings.sent1: The exciting book preoccupies me completely.
meanings.sent2: Her favorite TV show preoccupies her every evening.
meanings.sent3: The puzzle preoccupies me so much that I forget to eat!
meanings.sent4: His new hobby preoccupies his thoughts like a captivating mystery.
meanings.sent5: The beautiful scenery preoccupies my mind with its breathtaking views.

meanings.definition: To be constantly on someone's mind or thoughts.
meanings.sent1: The upcoming exam preoccupies her thoughts all day.
meanings.sent2: His words of encouragement preoccupy my mind when I feel down.
meanings.sent3: The idea of winning the lottery preoccupies my mind with dreams of luxury.
meanings.sent4: The memory of her smile preoccupies his thoughts like a warm embrace.
meanings.sent5: The thought of a vacation preoccupies my mind with visions of relaxation.

meanings.definition: To occupy or fill someone's time or attention.
meanings.sent1: The new project preoccupies my time at work.
meanings.sent2: Her responsibilities preoccupy her attention throughout the day.
meanings.sent3: The noisy neighbors preoccupy my thoughts with frustration.
meanings.sent4: The urgent deadline preoccupies his time like a ticking clock.
meanings.sent5: The interesting conversation preoccupies my attention with its engaging topics.
